short_summary: Perchè 100W PEMFC test stations performance evaluation for fuel cells
full_summary:
### Solicitation: 100W Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cell (PEMFC) Test Station

### Introduction
The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is seeking to procure a 100W Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cell (PEMFC) test station from qualified suppliers. The test station will be used to evaluate the performance of fuel cells at the NRC.

### Solicitation Details
* **Solicitation Number**: 23-58098
* **Amendment Number**: 5
* **Publication Date**: October 26, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: November 28, 2023, 2:00 PM EST
* **Trade Agreements**: Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* **Regions of Opportunity**: Canada
* **Regions of Delivery**: British Columbia, Canada

### Tender Description
The NRC requires the supply and delivery of one 100W PEMFC test station, which includes the following options:
* Automatic Multiple Gas Selector Valve Accessory
* Humidifier Water Drain and Fill Accessory
* Internal Mixing Mass Flow Controller
* Internal and External Mixing Mass Flow Controllers
* 5 cm2 and 25 cm2 Fuel Cell Test Fixture
* Heated Cuffs
* Cell Cooling Fans with Temperature Control
* Lab Kit

### Delivery Schedule
The delivery of the test station must be made on or before September 30, 2025.

### Instructions for Bid
All bids must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority no later than five (5) calendar days before the bid closing date. Enquiries received after that time may not be answered.

### Contact Information
* **Name**: Cindy Marshall
* **Email**: cindy.marshall@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca
* **Phone**: (647) 548-8469

### Request for Proposal
The NRC invites qualified suppliers to submit a proposal to supply and deliver the 100W PEMFC test station. The proposal must include all necessary information and documentation required to demonstrate the supplier's ability to meet the tender requirements.

### Note
The tender closing date was extended from November 15, 2023, to November 28, 2023. All bids must be submitted on or before the new closing date.

###
